donor_name: UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT FUND FOR WOME
outputs.output_descr: Government institutions are better able to manage, coordinate, and quality assure mine action in Sri Lanka

The project's purpose is to assist Sri Lanka to effectively address the humanitarian and development implications of landmine and Unexploded Ordnance (UXO) contamination in the affected areas. This will be accomplished by strengthening the Sri Lankan capacity for planning, co-coordinating, managing and implementing all aspects of mine action.

Support the resettlement and recovery of conflict-affected communities through UNDP supported Regional Mine Action Office (RMAO) staff to continue to support the Government Agents to coordinate and manage mine/explosive remnants of war (ERW) clearance and mine risk education in affected districts and International Technical Advisers (ITAs) to continue to provide technical guidance and assistance to the National Steering Committee on Mine Action (NSCMA), the RMAOs and demining operators.
Government institutions are better able to manage, coordinate and quality assure mine action in Sri Lanka
Socio-economic rehabilitation of crisis-affected and risk-prone communities and Internally Displaced Persons supported through an integrated approach to social cohesion and livelihoods.

project_descr: Support to the Sri Lanka National Mine Action Programme.
